intro: Gymnanthemum sahyadricum, commonly known as the Sahyadri gymnanthemum, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in dense forests. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, while its flowers are usually white or pale yellow. Gymnanthemum sahyadricum plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
